<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good Saturday morning. </strong>When you wash your hands today, make sure you sing “Happy Birthday” extra loud—we’re turning five! For nostalgia’s sake, let’s all read an excerpt from the Morning Brew’s first-ever newsletter (which was then a PDF called The Market Corner):</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“Wheat futures decreased today as traders exited positions to book profits from a recent upswing resulting from expectations that Russian moves to limit wheat exports would boost demand for US supplies.” </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">An update: </strong></span><span>Wheat futures fell for the third straight week. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And remember, our Brew socks + $5,000 giveaway is ending late Sunday night. See the bottom of the newsletter for details.</p>

</span><span><strong style="color:#000">On Capitol Hill: </strong></span><span>The House passed a </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/13/world/coronavirus-news-live-updates.html#link-521cc10d?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">major coronavirus relief package</a></span><span> that includes free testing for those without insurance, support for food programs, and two weeks of paid sick leave. It'll head to the Senate next week. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">

</span><span><strong style="color:#000">In the Rose Garden: </strong></span><span><span>President Trump </span></span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/83b0c8e168548fd453b0c177dd1f203a?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">declared</a></span><span><span> the coronavirus pandemic a “national emergency” and freed up to $50 billion for state and local governments to respond to the crisis. </span></span><span><strong style="color:#000"></strong></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>

He can write for the Brew any day.</span>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CORONAVIRUS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/13/coronavirus-testing-gets-important-backing?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Testing 1...2...3...
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="coronavirus image" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMDYvY29yb25hdmlydXNfaW1hZ2UuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One of the major criticisms of the U.S. government’s response to the coronavirus pandemic has been the woeful lack of testing capacity for the disease. Almost <a href="https://apnews.com/76b0f255426ad655a26e927062e1fef9?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">two months</a> after the first U.S. case was announced, the NIH’s top infectious disease expert said, “The system is not really geared to what we need right now...it is a failing, let’s admit it.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">That’s </strong><strong style="color:#000"><em>slowly </em></strong><strong style="color:#000">being remedied.</strong> Yesterday, the FDA gave <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-13/roche-gets-clearance-for-coronavirus-test-that-s-10-times-faster?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">emergency clearance</a> to a coronavirus test developed by the Swiss diagnostics giant Roche. This thing is Speedy Gonzales:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It can test patients 10x faster than existing tests.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Using Roche's automated machines, it can produce results in 3.5 hours.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The most powerful system can test up to 4,128 patients a day.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Roche Diagnostics CEO <span>Thomas Schinecker</span> said getting a new test developed and approved typically <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/fda-grants-new-coronavirus-test-emergency-approval-11584090078?mod=business_lead_pos2&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">takes years</a>. An “emergency team” started working on this one in January. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Other signs of life</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the Trump administration made a few other moves to ramp up testing. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">First, someone is now finally in charge of the government's testing effort—the assistant secretary of health, Brett Giroir. Next, the Department of Health and Human Services said it was <a href="https://www.hhs.gov/about/news/2020/03/13/hhs-funds-development-covid-19-diagnostic-tests.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">funding two companies</a>, DiaSorin Molecular and Qiagen, to push them along in developing diagnostic tests.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The agency said these tests may be able to detect coronavirus in “approximately one hour.” </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Looking ahead</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Dr. David Kessler, a former FDA commissioner, <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/13/opinion/coronavirus-testing.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">explained in the NYT</a> yesterday that there are a few ways the private sector can help expand testing capacity: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Delivery companies like FedEx, UPS, and Amazon can transfer specimens from mobile collection sites to labs.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Then, bring in the big guns:</strong></span><span> Apple, Microsoft, Google, and Salesforce can supply the data management systems to take those specimens and turn them into useful information. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>“There’s no reason the testing infrastructure can’t be up and running in seven days so that every person in America who needs a test can be tested,” Kessler wrote.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MARKETS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/13/recapping-crazy-week-financial-markets?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
What Doesn't Kill You Makes You More Volatile
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Wrestler rises from dead" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=376 src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/209/undertaker.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Wrestler rises from dead" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/209/undertaker.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Monday was the worst day for stocks since the financial crisis. Thursday was the worst day for stocks since 1987. Friday was the <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/03/12/futures-stock-market-coronavirus-concerns.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">best day for stocks</a> since 2008. Great week for setting records, impossible week for anyone trying to keep track of markets.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The one thing to remember:</strong> Volatility works in both directions.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">By Friday’s close, the Dow tallied a nearly 2,000-point gain and the S&P and Nasdaq surged, too. Still, the S&P fell <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-12/asia-stocks-set-to-tumble-after-wall-street-rout-markets-wrap?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more than 8% on the week</a> and the Dow about 10%.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But in these socially distant times, we take what we can get. While Friday was at least <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/global-selloff-extends-in-asia-11584061109?mod=article_inline&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">partially a response</a> to just how savage Thursday trading was, there were other reasons for stability:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>President Trump announced a plan of coronavirus action, including 50,000 new tests and relief for the energy sector.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Financial leaders around the world executed on equity-boosting strategies, from Norway and Canada cutting rates to Japan buying billions in government bonds to Italy and Spain banning some short-selling.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>You're lucky we didn't even talk about <a href="https://cointelegraph.com/news/crypto-traders-explain-what-caused-the-bitcoin-price-plunge-to-3-000?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bitcoin</a>. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENERGY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/13/occidental-adopts-poison-bill-ward-off-icahn?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
This Doesn't Look Like an Occident
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Occidental Petroleum will adopt a “<a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-13/occidental-deploys-poison-pill-amid-icahn-effort-to-oust-board?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">poison pill</a>” to ward off hostile takeover bids, because Advil only gets you so far when shares have dropped about 60% this month.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The details: </strong>The poison pill plan came one day after the OG activist investor Carl Icahn <a href="https://business.financialpost.com/pmn/business-pmn/occidental-adopts-poison-pill-after-icahn-raises-stake-to-about-10?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">upped his Occidental stake</a> to nearly 10% in a mission to fire the oil producer’s board.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The poison pill is a nifty corporate maneuver that makes the acquisition target's shares seem unattractive for a potential buyer. It’s a defensive tactic, like bolting the back door and shutting the blinds. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But for Icahn, the front door’s wide open. Oil prices are collapsing thanks to coronavirus and the Saudi/Russia price war...which started in part by targeting U.S. shale producers. In spectacularly bad timing, <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/buffett-and-occidental-weve-seen-this-movie-before-11583954449?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Occidental bet big on U.S. shale</a> with a $37 billion acquisition of Anadarko Petroleum last year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Icahn thinks the deal’s grounds for removal. </strong>With Occidental now worth less than one-third the price it paid for Anadarko, Icahn has quadrupled his investment and accused the company’s leadership of brokering “one of the worst disasters in financial history.”</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MISC
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/13/icymi-modells-soccer-tesla?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
ICYMI
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Elon Musk being interviewed" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMDUvZWxvbl9tdXNrX2JlaW5nX2ludGVydmlld2VkLmpwZWciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><a href="https://www.flickr.com/people/44124348109@N01" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Steve Jurvetson</a> from Menlo Park, USA, <a href="https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Elon_Musk_at_TED_2017.jpeg" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Elon Musk at TED 2017</a>, <a href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.0/legalcode" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CC BY 2.0</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Our weekly hub for non-coronavirus related news... </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">A billionaire CEO looks for a new facility:</strong> It’s not Bezos, but Elon Musk, who <a href="https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1237531699681980416?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1237531699681980416&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bloomberg.com%2Fnews%2Farticles%2F2020-03-11%2Ftesla-looking-for-cybertruck-plant-location-in-central-u-s&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tweeted</a> on Tuesday he’s “scouting locations for Cybertruck Gigafactory. Will be Central USA.” Using the same strategy in 2014, Musk got a $1.3 billion incentive package from Nevada, <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-11/tesla-looking-for-cybertruck-plant-location-in-central-u-s?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bloomberg notes</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Turmoil in U.S. Soccer: </strong>Carlos Cordeiro <a href="https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/51868203?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">resigned</a> as president of the U.S. Soccer Federation Thursday night. He was under pressure all week after legal filings claimed the women’s soccer team had “fewer responsibilities than their male colleagues.” Cindy Parlow Cone will take his place and become the federation’s first woman president in its 107-year history.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Modell’s goes bankrupt: </strong>The sporting goods retailer <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-modell-s-sporting-goods-bankruptcy/u-s-sporting-goods-retailer-modells-files-for-bankruptcy-protection-idUSKBN20Y39G?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">filed for Chapter 11</a> Wednesday. The company was founded in 1889, but back then Princeton was the best team in college football and Amazon and Walmart didn’t exist. Also, you’ll get a kick out of this: The CEO blamed lower jersey sales on the NY Jets and Giants being terrible.</p>

For nostalgia’s sake, let’s all read an excerpt from the Morning Brew’s first-ever newsletter (which was then a PDF called The Market Corner):\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“Wheat futures decreased today as traders exited positions to book profits from a recent upswing resulting from expectations that Russian moves to limit wheat exports would boost demand for US supplies.” \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAn update: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWheat futures fell for the third straight week. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd remember, our Brew socks + $5,000 giveaway is ending late Sunday night. It'll head to the Senate next week. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIn the Rose Garden: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePresident Trump \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/83b0c8e168548fd453b0c177dd1f203a?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edeclared\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the coronavirus pandemic a “national emergency” and freed up to $50 billion for state and local governments to respond to the crisis. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEurope: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGermany’s finance minister said the country is unleashing a “\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/germany-lines-600-billion-virus-141627410.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebazooka\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e” to support the economy. “We’ll check later to see if we need additional smaller weapons,” he said. He can write for the Brew any day.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nCORONAVIRUS\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/13/coronavirus-testing-gets-important-backing?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nTesting 1...2...3...\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"coronavirus image\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMDYvY29yb25hdmlydXNfaW1hZ2UuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOne of the major criticisms of the U.S. government’s response to the coronavirus pandemic has been the woeful lack of testing capacity for the disease. Almost \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/76b0f255426ad655a26e927062e1fef9?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etwo months\u003c/a\u003e after the first U.S. case was announced, the NIH’s top infectious disease expert said, “The system is not really geared to what we need right now...it is a failing, let’s admit it.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThat’s \u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eslowly \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ebeing remedied.\u003c/strong\u003e Yesterday, the FDA gave \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-13/roche-gets-clearance-for-coronavirus-test-that-s-10-times-faster?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eemergency clearance\u003c/a\u003e to a coronavirus test developed by the Swiss diagnostics giant Roche. This thing is Speedy Gonzales:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt can test patients 10x faster than existing tests.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eUsing Roche's automated machines, it can produce results in 3.5 hours.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe most powerful system can test up to 4,128 patients a day.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRoche Diagnostics CEO \u003cspan\u003eThomas Schinecker\u003c/span\u003e said getting a new test developed and approved typically \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/fda-grants-new-coronavirus-test-emergency-approval-11584090078?mod=business_lead_pos2\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etakes years\u003c/a\u003e. An “emergency team” started working on this one in January. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eOther signs of life\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the Trump administration made a few other moves to ramp up testing. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFirst, someone is now finally in charge of the government's testing effort—the assistant secretary of health, Brett Giroir. Next, the Department of Health and Human Services said it was \u003ca href=\"https://www.hhs.gov/about/news/2020/03/13/hhs-funds-development-covid-19-diagnostic-tests.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efunding two companies\u003c/a\u003e, DiaSorin Molecular and Qiagen, to push them along in developing diagnostic tests.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe agency said these tests may be able to detect coronavirus in “approximately one hour.” \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eLooking ahead\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDr. David Kessler, a former FDA commissioner, \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/13/opinion/coronavirus-testing.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexplained in the NYT\u003c/a\u003e yesterday that there are a few ways the private sector can help expand testing capacity: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDelivery companies like FedEx, UPS, and Amazon can transfer specimens from mobile collection sites to labs.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThen, bring in the big guns:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Apple, Microsoft, Google, and Salesforce can supply the data management systems to take those specimens and turn them into useful information. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003e“There’s no reason the testing infrastructure can’t be up and running in seven days so that every person in America who needs a test can be tested,” Kessler wrote.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMonday was the worst day for stocks since the financial crisis. Thursday was the worst day for stocks since 1987. Friday was the \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/03/12/futures-stock-market-coronavirus-concerns.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebest day for stocks\u003c/a\u003e since 2008. Great week for setting records, impossible week for anyone trying to keep track of markets.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe one thing to remember:\u003c/strong\u003e Volatility works in both directions.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBy Friday’s close, the Dow tallied a nearly 2,000-point gain and the S\u0026P and Nasdaq surged, too. Still, the S\u0026P fell \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-12/asia-stocks-set-to-tumble-after-wall-street-rout-markets-wrap?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emore than 8% on the week\u003c/a\u003e and the Dow about 10%.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut in these socially distant times, we take what we can get. While Friday was at least \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/global-selloff-extends-in-asia-11584061109?mod=article_inline\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epartially a response\u003c/a\u003e to just how savage Thursday trading was, there were other reasons for stability:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePresident Trump announced a plan of coronavirus action, including 50,000 new tests and relief for the energy sector.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFinancial leaders around the world executed on equity-boosting strategies, from Norway and Canada cutting rates to Japan buying style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOccidental Petroleum will adopt a “\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-13/occidental-deploys-poison-pill-amid-icahn-effort-to-oust-board?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epoison pill\u003c/a\u003e” to ward off hostile takeover bids, because Advil only gets you so far when shares have dropped about 60% this month.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe details: \u003c/strong\u003eThe poison pill plan came one day after the OG activist investor Carl Icahn \u003ca href=\"https://business.financialpost.com/pmn/business-pmn/occidental-adopts-poison-pill-after-icahn-raises-stake-to-about-10?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eupped his Occidental stake\u003c/a\u003e to nearly 10% in a mission to fire the oil producer’s board.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe poison pill is a nifty corporate maneuver that makes the acquisition target's shares seem unattractive for a potential buyer. It’s a defensive tactic, like bolting the back door and shutting the blinds. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut for Icahn, the front door’s wide open. Oil prices are collapsing thanks to coronavirus and the Saudi/Russia price war...which started in part by targeting U.S. shale producers. In spectacularly bad timing, \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/buffett-and-occidental-weve-seen-this-movie-before-11583954449?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eOccidental bet big on U.S. shale\u003c/a\u003e with a $37 billion acquisition of Anadarko Petroleum last year.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIcahn thinks the deal’s grounds for removal. \u003c/strong\u003eWith Occidental now worth less than one-third the price it paid for Anadarko, Icahn has quadrupled his investment and accused the company’s leadership of brokering “one of the worst target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etweeted\u003c/a\u003e on Tuesday he’s “scouting locations for Cybertruck Gigafactory. Will be Central USA.” Using the same strategy in 2014, Musk got a $1.3 billion incentive package from Nevada, \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-11/tesla-looking-for-cybertruck-plant-location-in-central-u-s?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eBloomberg notes\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTurmoil in U.S. Soccer: \u003c/strong\u003eCarlos Cordeiro \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/51868203?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eresigned\u003c/a\u003e as president of the U.S. Soccer Federation Thursday night. He was under pressure all week after legal filings claimed the women’s soccer team had “fewer responsibilities than their male colleagues.” Cindy Parlow Cone will take his place and become the federation’s first woman president in its 107-year history.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eModell’s goes bankrupt: \u003c/strong\u003eThe sporting goods retailer \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-modell-s-sporting-goods-bankruptcy/u-s-sporting-goods-retailer-modells-files-for-bankruptcy-protection-idUSKBN20Y39G?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efiled for Chapter 11\u003c/a\u003e Wednesday. The company was founded in 1889, but back then Princeton was the best team in college football and Amazon and Walmart didn’t exist.
